{"text":"The idea is to build a Android Apk called "HotCocoa". It is intended to be a couples app, with "adult" or "NSFW" content. 

Users upload photos that are stored in the app (they can add via filesystem OR Google Drive). When the users want, they can "start the experience". A local LLM model analyzes the images and creates text descriptions, which are sent to another LLM that has a custom made system prompt. This model outputs text. The text will be either a "dare" or a question, directed to the couple and based off of the picture. Each "round" (question or dare/challange - they are not "oposite", just different options) is a different picture. 

The apk/app exists. Its built with Tauri and the overall theme is in the right direction. It has custom spinners and a color pallet that follows the "couples/NSFW" thematic. Attached are screenshots of the apps current state. Layouts are broken, buttons are MASSIVE. It needs a complete refactor/remake. 

The app has a config button that allows lots of customization, including changing the app from a "hot" mode to a "love" mode ("love" mode is meant to generate emotional "things"; "hot" is what I described above). Also has a "chat" feature so the users can talk with the Text Generation Model to improve/customize instructions. 

What I Intended/Would Like To Be Rendered

Home Screen (Upload)

Imagine the mobile screen as a vertical rectangle. At the absolute top is the Android status bar with the time and icons - this area belongs to the system and the app does not touch it.

Just below the status bar, there is some breathing space (about 8-16 pixels), and then the app header begins: a horizontal bar with a height of 48 pixels, a slightly elevated background (subtle dark brown), containing the text "HotCocoa" centered in a pinkish font, and a gear icon to the right. This header remains fixed at the top.

The main content starts below the header. Vertically centered in the available space (between the header and the bottom area), we have:

The title "Our Memories" (Nossas Memórias) in a large, pinkish font, without glow effects

Below, the subtitle "Select photos to start" in a smaller, more transparent font

Two cards side-by-side occupying about 80% of the screen width, with equal spacing between them and from the edges. Each card is about 100-120 pixels high, has a dark brown background, rounded corners, and contains an icon centered above descriptive text

Below the cards, a text link for configuration

At the bottom of the screen, before the Android navigation bar, there is a subtle footer with tiny version text. The Android navigation bar (back/home/recent buttons) sits outside the app area - there is a clear separation, the app content ends before where the bar begins.

Viewing Screen (with photo)

The photo occupies the upper area but starts below the header, not behind it. The header has a solid or semi-transparent background that does not let the photo bleed through behind it.

The photo is displayed uniquely, without duplications or strange cropping. It occupies perhaps 40-50% of the screen height.

Below the photo, there is a control area with a solid dark background:

Centered round indicator

Action title

Intensity slider that occupies the full width with visible and unclipped labels

Action button at the bottom

The action button has enough bottom margin not to overlap the Android navigation bar. A safe area is respected.

Configuration Modal

The modal appears centered on the screen, with a dark semi-transparent background behind it (overlay). The modal itself has:

Width of 85-90% of the screen

Solid dark brown background

Rounded corners

Generous internal padding

No elements leaking through the edges

Content completely visible without clipping"}

{"text":"I'll help you rebuild the HotCocoa app with proper layouts and spacing for a mobile experience. Let me start by exploring the current structure and then create a clean, well-organized mobile UI.","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"The user wants to build an Android app called "HotCocoa" - a couples app with NSFW content. They've provided screenshots showing the current broken state of the app and detailed specifications for how they want it to look.

Let me break down what they need:

1. **Home Screen (Upload)**
   - Fixed header with "HotCocoa" title and gear icon
   - "Our Memories" / "Nossas Memórias" title
   - "Select photos to start" subtitle
   - Two cards side-by-side for file upload (Dispositivo/Filesystem and Google Drive)
   - Configuration link below
   - Version footer at bottom

2. **Viewing Screen (with photo)**
   - Header at top (not overlapped by photo)
   - Photo display (40-50% of screen height)
   - Control area below with:
     - Round indicator
     - Action title
     - Intensity slider (full width, visible labels)
     - Action button at bottom

3. **Configuration Modal**
   - Centered modal with dark overlay
   - 85-90% screen width
   - Dark brown background
   - Contains:
     - Experience mode toggle (HOT vs WARM/LOVE)
     - Model parameters (Temperature, Max Tokens)
     - Proper padding and no clipping

The app uses Tauri, has a dark brown/pinkish color scheme for the couples/NSFW theme.

Looking at the screenshots:
- Screenshot 1: Shows the config modal with mode selection (HOT vs WARM) and model parameters
- Screenshot 2: Shows the home screen with "Nossas Memórias", file upload options
- Screenshot 3: Shows the viewing screen with a photo and calibration controls

This is a pure frontend request - they want me to rebuild the UI/layouts for a mobile app. I should classify this as **PureFrontend** since they're asking for a UI refactor/remake, not backend functionality (the Tauri app already exists with LLM integration).
 
I'll start by examining the current file structure, then rebuild the React components with proper mobile-first layouts using their dark brown and pinkish color palette. I need to set up the viewport correctly, structure the screens as separate components, implement the modal overlay for settings, and add a slider for the intensity control. I'll use lucide-react for icons and ensure spacing and safe areas work properly across the layout.","signature":""}

{"toolCallId":"toolu_vrtx_01AA61WEoeXuws9YWHucVuHA","toolName":"write_tool","argsJson":"{\"path\":\"/src/app/components/HotCocoaSlider.tsx\",\"file_text\":\"import * as React from \\\"react\\\";\\nimport * as SliderPrimitive from \\\"@radix-ui/react-slider\\\";\\nimport { cn } from \\\"@/app/components/ui/utils\\\";\\n\\ninterface HotCocoaSliderProps extends React.ComponentProps<typeof SliderPrimitive.Root> {\\n  className?: string;\\n}\\n\\nexport function HotCocoaSlider({\\n  className,\\n  defaultValue,\\n  value,\\n  min = 0,\\n  max = 100,\\n  ...props\\n}: HotCocoaSliderProps) {\\n  const _values = React.useMemo(\\n    () =>\\n      Array.isArray(value)\\n        ? value\\n        : Array.isArray(defaultValue)\\n          ? defaultValue\\n          : [min, max],\\n    [value, defaultValue, min, max],\\n  );\\n\\n  return (\\n    <SliderPrimitive.Root\\n      defaultValue={defaultValue}\\n      value={value}\\n      min={min}\\n      max={max}\\n      className={cn(\\n        \\\"relative flex w-full touch-none items-center select-none\\\",\\n        className,\\n      )}\\n      {...props}\\n    >\\n      <SliderPrimitive.Track\\n        className=\\\"relative w-full h-2 rounded-full overflow-hidden\\\"\\n        style={{ backgroundColor: 'var(--hotcocoa-border)' }}\\n      >\\n        <SliderPrimitive.Range\\n          className=\\\"absolute h-full\\\"\\n          style={{ backgroundColor: 'var(--hotcocoa-accent)' }}\\n        />\\n      </SliderPrimitive.Track>\\n      {Array.from({ length: _values.length }, (_, index) => (\\n        <SliderPrimitive.Thumb\\n          key={index}\\n          className=\\\"block w-5 h-5 rounded-full border-2 shadow-lg transition-all hover:scale-110 focus:scale-110 focus:outline-none\\\"\\n          style={{\\n            backgroundColor: 'var(--hotcocoa-text-primary)',\\n            borderColor: 'var(--hotcocoa-accent)',\\n          }}\\n        />\\n      ))}\\n    </SliderPrimitive.Root>\\n  );\\n}\\n\"}"}

{"toolCallId":"toolu_vrtx_01L17sLNkANGQ2RJ5pkhbM7j","toolName":"write_tool","argsJson":"{\"path\":\"/src/styles/hotcocoa.css\",\"file_text\":\"/* HotCocoa App Custom Styles */\\n\\n/* Mobile viewport configuration */\\n@supports (height: 100dvh) {\\n  .h-screen {\\n    height: 100dvh;\\n  }\\n}\\n\\n/* Custom input range styling for ConfigModal */\\ninput[type=\\\"range\\\"] {\\n  -webkit-appearance: none;\\n  appearance: none;\\n  background: transparent;\\n  cursor: pointer;\\n}\\n\\ninput[type=\\\"range\\\"]::-webkit-slider-thumb {\\n  -webkit-appearance: none;\\n  appearance: none;\\n  width: 18px;\\n  height: 18px;\\n  border-radius: 50%;\\n  background: var(--hotcocoa-text-primary);\\n  border: 2px solid var(--hotcocoa-accent);\\n  cursor: pointer;\\n  transition: all 0.2s;\\n}\\n\\ninput[type=\\\"range\\\"]::-webkit-slider-thumb:hover {\\n  transform: scale(1.1);\\n}\\n\\ninput[type=\\\"range\\\"]::-webkit-slider-thumb:active {\\n  transform: scale(1.15);\\n}\\n\\ninput[type=\\\"range\\\"]::-moz-range-thumb {\\n  width: 18px;\\n  height: 18px;\\n  border-radius: 50%;\\n  background: var(--hotcocoa-text-primary);\\n  border: 2px solid var(--hotcocoa-accent);\\n  cursor: pointer;\\n  transition: all 0.2s;\\n}\\n\\ninput[type=\\\"range\\\"]::-moz-range-thumb:hover {\\n  transform: scale(1.1);\\n}\\n\\ninput[type=\\\"range\\\"]::-moz-range-thumb:active {\\n  transform: scale(1.15);\\n}\\n\\n/* Prevent text selection on touch devices */\\n.select-none {\\n  -webkit-user-select: none;\\n  user-select: none;\\n  -webkit-touch-callout: none;\\n}\\n\\n/* Smooth scrolling */\\n* {\\n  -webkit-tap-highlight-color: transparent;\\n}\\n\\n/* Safe area insets for notched devices */\\n@supports (padding: max(0px)) {\\n  body {\\n    padding-top: env(safe-area-inset-top);\\n    padding-bottom: env(safe-area-inset-bottom);\\n    padding-left: env(safe-area-inset-left);\\n    padding-right: env(safe-area-inset-right);\\n  }\\n}\\n\"}"}

{"toolCallId":"toolu_vrtx_01HmoApErrZerpC5DDAZ7Q59","toolName":"write_tool","argsJson":"{\"path\":\"/src/app/components/ParticleBackground.tsx\",\"file_text\":\"import { useEffect, useRef } from \\\"react\\\";\\n\\nexport function ParticleBackground() {\\n  const canvasRef = useRef<HTMLCanvasElement>(null);\\n\\n  useEffect(() => {\\n    const canvas = canvasRef.current;\\n    if (!canvas) return;\\n\\n    const ctx = canvas.getContext(\\\"2d\\\");\\n    if (!ctx) return;\\n\\n    // Set canvas size\\n    const updateCanvasSize = () => {\\n      canvas.width = window.innerWidth;\\n      canvas.height = window.innerHeight;\\n    };\\n    updateCanvasSize();\\n    window.addEventListener(\\\"resize\\\", updateCanvasSize);\\n\\n    // Particle class\\n    class Particle {\\n      x: number;\\n      y: number;\\n      size: number;\\n      speedY: number;\\n      opacity: number;\\n      color: string;\\n\\n      constructor() {\\n        this.x = Math.random() * canvas.width;\\n        this.y = Math.random() * canvas.height;\\n        this.size = Math.random() * 3 + 1;\\n        this.speedY = Math.random() * 0.5 + 0.2;\\n        this.opacity = Math.random() * 0.3 + 0.1;\\n        \\n        // Random colors from pink/brown palette\\n        const colors = [\\n          \\\"rgba(232, 125, 143, \\\",\\n          \\\"rgba(184, 144, 144, \\\",\\n          \\\"rgba(245, 213, 213, \\\",\\n          \\\"rgba(120, 80, 80, \\\",\\n        ];\\n        this.color = colors[Math.floor(Math.random() * colors.length)];\\n      }\\n\\n      update() {\\n        this.y -= this.speedY;\\n        if (this.y < -10) {\\n          this.y = canvas.height + 10;\\n          this.x = Math.random() * canvas.width;\\n        }\\n      }\\n\\n      draw() {\\n        if (!ctx) return;\\n        ctx.fillStyle = this.color + this.opacity + \\\")\\\";\\n        ctx.beginPath();\\n        ctx.arc(this.x, this.y, this.size, 0, Math.PI * 2);\\n        ctx.fill();\\n      }\\n    }\\n\\n    // Create particles\\n    const particles: Particle[] = [];\\n    for (let i = 0; i < 50; i++) {\\n      particles.push(new Particle());\\n    }\\n\\n    // Animation loop\\n    let animationFrameId: number;\\n    const animate = () => {\\n      ctx.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);\\n      \\n      particles.forEach((particle) => {\\n        particle.update();\\n        particle.draw();\\n      });\\n\\n      animationFrameId = requestAnimationFrame(animate);\\n    };\\n    animate();\\n\\n    return () => {\\n      window.removeEventListener(\\\"resize\\\", updateCanvasSize);\\n      cancelAnimationFrame(animationFrameId);\\n    };\\n  }, []);\\n\\n  return (\\n    <canvas\\n      ref={canvasRef}\\n      className=\\\"absolute inset-0 pointer-events-none\\\"\\n      style={{ opacity: 0.4 }}\\n    />\\n  );\\n}\\n\"}"}

I've successfully rebuilt the HotCocoa couples app with a complete mobile-first redesign. The app now features properly structured layouts with fixed spacing, a custom dark brown/pinkish color theme, and smooth mobile interactions across three main screens: Home (photo upload), Viewing (calibration), and Chat (AI assistant).

**Key features implemented:**
- Fixed header (48px) with back navigation and settings button
- Home screen with animated particle background and upload cards
- Viewing screen with photo display, custom intensity slider, and protocol button
- Configuration modal with HOT/WARM mode toggle and model parameters
- Chat interface for AI conversations
- Mobile-safe spacing with proper viewport handling
- Demo controls for easy screen navigation

The layouts now respect mobile safe areas, buttons are properly sized (no more massive elements), and all components follow the couples/NSFW theme with consistent color variables and typography.","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"Dynamic Theming System: "Hot" vs. "Warm" Modes
Objective: Implement a global state-based theming engine that triggers a complete visual overhaul when the user toggles between "HOT" and "WARM" modes in the Configuration Modal. This change must be immediate and pervasive, providing clear visual feedback on the current emotional state of the app.

1. The Trigger Interaction: When the user selects a mode in the "Experience Mode" toggle:

Action: The entire application's color palette (backgrounds, buttons, accents, text) must transition to the corresponding theme.

2. Theme Definitions:

HOT Mode (Default/Current):

Vibe: Visceral, Explicit, Night-time, Intense.

Palette: Deep Dark Chocolate/Black backgrounds, High-Contrast Text, "Spicy" Red/Pink accents (#FF4D6D range), and sharp UI borders.

Feeling: High energy and bold.

WARM Mode (The New State):

Vibe: Deep, Emotional, Intimate, Cozy.

Palette:

Backgrounds: Softer, lighter warm browns (think Latte or Mocha tones, not black).

Accents: Soft Amber, Gold, or Terracotta (instead of the Hot Pink).

Buttons: Muted, earthy tones.

Text: Cream/Off-white instead of stark white.

Feeling: Comfortable, romantic, and soft.

3. Scope of Change: The theme switch must affect:

The Main Background: Use CSS variables/state to swap the background color.

Primary Action Buttons: The "Save Settings" and "Protocol" buttons must change color.

The Slider: The "Intensity" and "Temperature" sliders should track the accent color (Pink for Hot, Amber/Gold for Warm).

Header & Modal Backgrounds: These should adjust to match the lighter/softer "Warm" tone or the darker "Hot" tone.

Why: To establish a strong psychological distinction between the two user intents and increase the perceived production value of the app.

**never use emojis**

Design System & Iconography: Material Design 3
Standardization Directive: Please strictly adhere to Google's Material Design 3 (Material You) guidelines for all UI components and iconography to ensure a native Android feel on the Galaxy S24.

Specific Requirements:

Iconography:

Use Google Material Symbols (Rounded variant) for all icons.

Ensure icons are consistently sized (24dp for actions) and aligned.

Example: The "Gear" setting icon should be the standard filled or outlined MD3 gear.

Components:

Sliders: Use the MD3 slider style (track with a handle, active portion colored).

Switches/Toggles: Use the MD3 pill-shaped toggle switches (especially for the Hot/Warm mode selector).

Cards: Maintain the MD3 "Elevated Card" or "Filled Card" concept with appropriate corner radii (usually 12dp-16dp).

Ripple Effects: If possible, implement the subtle ink ripple effect on button taps.

Why: To ensure the interface feels modern, familiar to Android users, and touch-friendly with correct hit-targets (min 48x48dp)."}

compression.summaryText:
## Background
I'm building an Android APK called "HotCocoa" - a couples app with adult/NSFW content built with Tauri. Users upload photos that get analyzed by local LLM models to generate text descriptions, which are then sent to another LLM with custom prompts to create "dares" or questions for couples based on the images. The app has a config system allowing customization between "hot" mode (NSFW content) and "love" mode (emotional content), plus a chat feature for users to interact with the text generation model. The app needed a complete UI refactor because the original layouts were broken with massive buttons and poor mobile spacing.

## Current state
I've completely rebuilt the mobile UI with proper layouts, a custom dark brown/pinkish color theme, and three main screens: Home (photo upload with particle background), Viewing (photo display with intensity slider and protocol button), and Chat (AI conversation interface). The app now has a fixed 48px header, mobile-safe spacing, a configuration modal with HOT/WARM mode toggles, and demo controls for easy navigation between screens.

{"text":"The user wants me to implement a dynamic theming system for their HotCocoa app that switches between "HOT" and "WARM" modes. They also want me to adopt Material Design 3 guidelines for iconography and components.

Key requirements:
1. Dynamic theming that switches the entire app's visual appearance when toggling between HOT and WARM modes
2. HOT mode: Dark chocolate/black backgrounds, high contrast, spicy red/pink accents (#FF4D6D), sharp UI
3. WARM mode: Softer warm browns (latte/mocha), soft amber/gold/terracotta accents, muted earthy tones, cream/off-white text
4. The theme should affect: backgrounds, buttons, sliders, header, modals
5. Use Material Design 3 guidelines: Material Symbols (Rounded), MD3 sliders, pill-shaped toggles, elevated cards with 12-16dp radius, ripple effects
6. Never use emojis

I need to:
1. First, explore the current file structure to understand the codebase
2. Set up a global theme context/state
3. Define theme variables for both HOT and WARM modes
4. Update all components to use these theme variables
5. Replace icons with Material Design 3 icons (likely lucide-react or a Material icons library)
6. Update UI components to match MD3 guidelines

Let me start by exploring the current structure.","signature":""}

{"toolCallId":"toolu_018MQZTSTiHHuasj3FQANiTX","toolName":"write_tool","argsJson":"{\"path\":\"/src/app/contexts/ThemeContext.tsx\",\"file_text\":\"import { createContext, useContext, useState, useEffect, ReactNode } from 'react';\\n\\nexport type ThemeMode = 'hot' | 'warm';\\n\\ninterface ThemeContextType {\\n  mode: ThemeMode;\\n  setMode: (mode: ThemeMode) => void;\\n}\\n\\nconst ThemeContext = createContext<ThemeContextType | undefined>(undefined);\\n\\nexport function ThemeProvider({ children }: { children: ReactNode }) {\\n  const [mode, setMode] = useState<ThemeMode>('hot');\\n\\n  useEffect(() => {\\n    // Apply theme to document root\\n    document.documentElement.setAttribute('data-theme', mode);\\n  }, [mode]);\\n\\n  return (\\n    <ThemeContext.Provider value={{ mode, setMode }}>\\n      {children}\\n    </ThemeContext.Provider>\\n  );\\n}\\n\\nexport function useTheme() {\\n  const context = useContext(ThemeContext);\\n  if (context === undefined) {\\n    throw new Error('useTheme must be used within a ThemeProvider');\\n  }\\n  return context;\\n}\\n\"}"}

{"toolCallId":"toolu_01T2WkGCA7xyvKvLV116qWxT","toolName":"fast_apply_tool","argsJson":"{\"path\":\"/src/app/components/ParticleBackground.tsx\",\"change_str\":\"import { useEffect, useRef } from \\\"react\\\";\\nimport { useTheme } from \\\"@/app/contexts/ThemeContext\\\";\\n\\nexport function ParticleBackground() {\\n  const canvasRef = useRef<HTMLCanvasElement>(null);\\n  const { mode } = useTheme();\\n\\n  useEffect(() => {\\n    const canvas = canvasRef.current;\\n    if (!canvas) return;\\n\\n    const ctx = canvas.getContext(\\\"2d\\\");\\n    if (!ctx) return;\\n\\n    // Set canvas size\\n    const updateCanvasSize = () => {\\n      canvas.width = window.innerWidth;\\n      canvas.height = window.innerHeight;\\n    };\\n    updateCanvasSize();\\n    window.addEventListener(\\\"resize\\\", updateCanvasSize);\\n\\n    // Particle class\\n    class Particle {\\n      x: number;\\n      y: number;\\n      size: number;\\n      speedY: number;\\n      opacity: number;\\n      color: string;\\n\\n      constructor() {\\n        this.x = Math.random() * canvas.width;\\n        this.y = Math.random() * canvas.height;\\n        this.size = Math.random() * 3 + 1;\\n        this.speedY = Math.random() * 0.5 + 0.2;\\n        this.opacity = Math.random() * 0.3 + 0.1;\\n        \\n        // Theme-aware colors\\n        const colors = mode === 'hot' \\n          ? [\\n              \\\"rgba(232, 125, 143, \\\",\\n              \\\"rgba(184, 144, 144, \\\",\\n              \\\"rgba(245, 213, 213, \\\",\\n              \\\"rgba(120, 80, 80, \\\",\\n            ]\\n          : [\\n              \\\"rgba(212, 145, 94, \\\",\\n              \\\"rgba(107, 82, 63, \\\",\\n              \\\"rgba(217, 196, 175, \\\",\\n              \\\"rgba(194, 125, 74, \\\",\\n            ];\\n        this.color = colors[Math.floor(Math.random() * colors.length)];\\n      }\\n\\n      update() {\\n        this.y -= this.speedY;\\n        if (this.y < -10) {\\n          this.y = canvas.height + 10;\\n          this.x = Math.random() * canvas.width;\\n        }\\n      }\\n\\n      draw() {\\n        if (!ctx) return;\\n        ctx.fillStyle = this.color + this.opacity + \\\")\\\";\\n        ctx.beginPath();\\n        ctx.arc(this.x, this.y, this.size, 0, Math.PI * 2);\\n        ctx.fill();\\n      }\\n    }\\n\\n    // Create particles\\n    const particles: Particle[] = [];\\n    for (let i = 0; i < 50; i++) {\\n      particles.push(new Particle());\\n    }\\n\\n    // Animation loop\\n    let animationFrameId: number;\\n    const animate = () => {\\n      ctx.clearRect(0, 0, canvas.width, canvas.height);\\n      \\n      particles.forEach((particle) => {\\n        particle.update();\\n        particle.draw();\\n      });\\n\\n      animationFrameId = requestAnimationFrame(animate);\\n    };\\n    animate();\\n\\n    return () => {\\n      window.removeEventListener(\\\"resize\\\", updateCanvasSize);\\n      cancelAnimationFrame(animationFrameId);\\n    };\\n  }, [mode]);\\n\\n  return (\\n    <canvas\\n      ref={canvasRef}\\n      className=\\\"absolute inset-0 pointer-events-none\\\"\\n      style={{ opacity: 0.4 }}\\n    />\\n  );\\n}\\n\"}"}

0.2))\\n\\n**Feeling:** High energy, bold, passionate, and intense\\n\\n### WARM Mode\\n**Vibe:** Deep, Emotional, Intimate, Cozy\\n\\n**Palette:**\\n- Background: Latte/Cream (#f5e6d3)\\n- Card Background: Soft Mocha (#e8d4bf)\\n- Header Background: Warm Beige (#d9c4af)\\n- Primary Text: Dark Brown (#3d2817)\\n- Secondary Text: Muted Brown (#6b523f)\\n- Accent: Soft Amber/Terracotta (#d4915e)\\n- Accent Hover: Darker Amber (#c27d4a)\\n- Border: Translucent Amber (rgba(212, 145, 94, 0.3))\\n\\n**Feeling:** Comfortable, romantic, soft, and emotional\\n\\n## Implementation\\n\\n### Theme Context\\n\\nThe theming system uses React Context for global state management:\\n\\n```tsx\\nimport { useTheme } from \\\"@/app/contexts/ThemeContext\\\";\\n\\nfunction MyComponent() {\\n  const { mode, setMode } = useTheme();\\n  \\n  // Use the current mode\\n  console.log(mode); // \\\"hot\\\" or \\\"warm\\\"\\n  \\n  // Switch modes\\n  setMode(\\\"warm\\\");\\n}\\n```\\n\\n### CSS Variables\\n\\nAll theme colors are defined as CSS variables that automatically update when the theme changes:\\n\\n```css\\n/* Usage in components */\\nstyle={{ \\n  backgroundColor: 'var(--hotcocoa-bg)',\\n  color: 'var(--hotcocoa-text-primary)',\\n  borderColor: 'var(--hotcocoa-accent)'\\n}}\\n```\\n\\n### Available CSS Variables\\n\\n- `--hotcocoa-bg`: Main background color\\n- `--hotcocoa-card-bg`: Card/modal background color\\n- `--hotcocoa-header-bg`: Header background color\\n- `--hotcocoa-text-primary`: Primary text color\\n- `--hotcocoa-text-secondary`: Secondary text color\\n- `--hotcocoa-accent`: Accent/brand color\\n- `--hotcocoa-accent-hover`: Accent hover state\\n- `--hotcocoa-border`: Border color\\n\\n### Smooth Transitions\\n\\nAll color changes are animated with smooth 300ms transitions defined in `/src/styles/hotcocoa.css`:\\n\\n```css\\n:root, body, div, button, input, header, footer, main {\\n  transition-property: background-color, border-color, color;\\n  transition-duration: 300ms;\\n  transition-timing-function: ease-in-out;\\n}\\n```\\n\\n## Material Design 3 Integration\\n\\nThe app follows Google's Material Design 3 guidelines:\\n\\n### Icons\\n- All icons use Material Symbols Rounded variant from `@mui/icons-material`\\n- Consistent 24dp size for action icons\\n- Example: `<SettingsRounded sx={{ fontSize: 24 }} />`\\n\\n### Touch Targets\\n- Minimum 48x48dp touch targets for all interactive elements\\n- Implemented with `minWidth: '48px', minHeight: '48px'`\\n\\n### Corner Radii\\n- Cards: 16dp (16px) - `/src/styles/md3-ripple.css`\\n\\n## Affected Components\\n\\nAll components respond to theme changes:\\n\\n1. **Header** - Shows current mode badge, transitions all colors\\n2. **ConfigModal** - Toggle between modes, theme-aware UI\\n3. **HomeScreen** - Background, cards, text all adapt\\n4. **ViewingScreen** - Photo viewer, controls, buttons adapt\\n5. **ChatScreen** - Message bubbles, input field adapt\\n6. **DemoControls** - Navigation buttons adapt\\n7. **HotCocoaSlider** - Slider track and thumb colors adapt\\n8. **ParticleBackground** - Particle colors change based on theme\\n\\n## Mode Switching\\n\\nUsers can switch themes in two ways:\\n\\n1. **Configuration Modal**: Click the settings icon in the header, select HOT or WARM mode\\n2. **Programmatically**: Use `setMode()` from the theme context\\n\\nThe theme change is:\\n- Immediate (300ms smooth transition)\\n- Global (affects entire app)\\n- Persistent across navigation\\n- Visible in header badge\\n\\n## Best Practices\\n\\nWhen creating new components:\\n\\n1. Use CSS variables for colors: `var(--hotcocoa-*)`\\n2. Add `transition-colors duration-300` className\\n3. Use `useTheme()` hook for conditional logic\\n4. Follow MD3 guidelines for touch targets and radii\\n5. Test in both HOT and WARM modes for contrast\\n\\n## Technical Details\\n\\n- Theme stored in React Context\\n- CSS variables update via `data-theme` attribute on `<html>`\\n- No page reload required\\n- Transitions handled purely by CSS\\n- Material UI icons for consistent design language\\n\"}"}

{"text":"Perfect! I've successfully implemented a comprehensive dynamic theming system with Material Design 3 integration for your HotCocoa app. The entire application now seamlessly switches between HOT and WARM modes with smooth transitions and proper visual feedback.

## What was implemented:

**Dynamic Theming System:**
- Created a global ThemeContext that manages HOT and WARM modes
- HOT Mode: Dark, visceral palette with spicy pink accents (#e87d8f) - perfect for the explicit, intense experience
- WARM Mode: Light, cozy palette with soft amber/terracotta accents (#d4915e) - ideal for the emotional, intimate experience
- All color changes animate smoothly with 300ms transitions

**Material Design 3 Adoption:**
- Replaced all Lucide icons with Material Symbols Rounded from @mui/icons-material
- Implemented proper 48dp minimum touch targets on all interactive elements
- Applied MD3 border radius standards (16dp for cards, 12dp for buttons)
- Added MD3 ripple effects and elevation shadows
- Consistent 24dp icon sizing throughout

**Theme-Aware Components:**
Every component now responds to theme changes including Header, ConfigModal, HomeScreen, ViewingScreen, ChatScreen, DemoControls, HotCocoaSlider, and even the ParticleBackground with theme-specific particle colors.

**Visual Feedback:**
- Mode indicator badge in the header showing current theme
- Animated toast notification when switching themes
- All buttons, sliders, and text adapt their colors instantly

You can now toggle between HOT and WARM modes in the Configuration Modal, and watch the entire app transform with smooth, professional transitions that provide clear psychological distinction between the two experiences.","textMode":"visible_message"}
